data.title: Michael Jackson tribute in Rochester Nov. 10
data.meta_description: ROCHESTER — Experience the essence of Michael Jackson when the Rochester Opera House presents King Michael: A Glorious Tribute to the King of Pop on Saturday, Nov. 10 at 8 p.m. (doors 7 p.m.). Celebr…
data.text:
ROCHESTER — Experience the essence of Michael Jackson when the Rochester Opera House presents King Michael: A Glorious Tribute to the King of Pop on Saturday, Nov. 10 at 8 p.m. (doors 7 p.m.). Celebrate the life of the greatest entertainer of all time in this multi-media spectacular, featuring artists approved by the King himself. Feel the electrifying power of Michael Jackson’s most thrilling hits: Billie Jean, Beat It and Thriller.

The amazing cast includes the world’s best Michael Jackson tribute singers and dancers along with all-star acrobatic break-dancers, poppers and lockers, accompanied by a live band with specialty percussionists. John Salvato (Caesar’s Palace) says, “Producer Steve Love really nailed it on the head by assembling a brilliant ensemble of the best in the business… simply world class! The audience was blown away from the moment the show started to the climactic finale.”

Reserve tickets ($25/$27/$32) online at www.rochesteroperahouse.com or call/stop by the box office (603) 335-1992, Mondays, Wednesdays or Fridays, from 10 a.m.-5 p.m. or two hours before the show. Cash bar. Patrons aged 17 and under must be accompanied by an adult. This show is sponsored by Eastern Propane and Oil, L. Wynn Sound, Foster’s Daily Democrat, Shaheen and Gordon, P.A., Norman Vetter Foundations and WBBY the Bay. The Rochester Opera House is located in City Hall, 31 Wakefield St. The season continues with Kashmir: The Led Zeppelin Show Nov. 16 and Rockin’ Schoolhouse Nov. 17 and 18.
